name.japanese: ホールケーキアイランド

keyEvents.title: Whole Cake Island First Appearance
keyEvents.description: Whole Cake Island is shown for the first time as Big Mom's base of operations. The island appears to be themed around sweets and desserts.
keyEvents.significance: First introduction of the main setting for the future Whole Cake Island arc, one of the most important locations in the New World.

keyEvents.title: Big Mom's Headquarters
keyEvents.description: Established as the headquarters of the Big Mom Pirates and territory of one of the Four Emperors.
keyEvents.significance: Reveals the base of operations for one of the most powerful forces in the One Piece world.

description: A candy-themed island in the New World that serves as Big Mom's main base of operations. The island and its surroundings are part of Totto Land, Big Mom's territory.

reveals.information: Serves as the headquarters of the Big Mom Pirates
The island has a sweets and candy theme, reflecting Big Mom's obsession

keyEvents.title: Pekoms and Tamago at Candy Factory
keyEvents.description: Pekoms and Tamago arrive at the candy factory to collect Big Mom's monthly tribute, only to learn it was destroyed by Hody.
keyEvents.significance: The candy factory becomes the setting for the confrontation that leads to Luffy's war declaration against Big Mom.

keyEvents.title: Site of Luffy's War Declaration
keyEvents.description: The candy factory serves as the location where Luffy declares war on Big Mom and claims Fish-Man Island as his territory.
keyEvents.significance: Becomes a historically significant location where a major challenge to a Yonko was issued.

description: A candy production facility on Fish-Man Island that was responsible for producing 10 tons of candy monthly as tribute to Big Mom. The factory was destroyed during Hody Jones' attack on the island.

reveals.information: Produced 10 tons of candy monthly as tribute to Big Mom for protection of Fish-Man Island
Destroyed by Hody Jones during his attack, unable to fulfill tribute obligations
